ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Skills Learned: 
Improved CAD skills
How to tap printed plastic
The usage of bearings 
How to make springs and measure their spring constant 
Current and voltage regulation
App design and integration
We made a VR simulation as our project.
How to manage the development of an independent project and help carry a product through the full R&D cycle from conception to live demonstration.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Not enough contact with our advisor

Strengths: Very flexible, learn a lot through project base learning
Weakness: need to be Self-motivated

Many of the strengths will depend on your advisor and your own commitment to the development of your project. So, the level of engagement can be improved by the advisor committing to meet with the students frequently enough and making sure to check in on their progress regularly.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If they are upper level electrical engineers and are looking to experience a higher degree of freedom with their work, yes
Yes! Allows you to work on whatever project you want. Pick a professor that will give you time and advice on whatever project you are working on

Yes, if you have a lab project you would like to carry out for credit or have discussed an independent project in depth with an advisor. You will get out of it what you put in. Know that you have to provide a report and possibly a live demo (depending on what your advisor wants) of the work you conducted throughout the semester. I would recommend doing this in a small group so that you can hold each other accountable for actually showing up and getting the work done.
